meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tactile.
meanings.sent1: The tactilities of the soft fabric made it pleasant to touch.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the tactilities of the rough surface under her fingertips.
meanings.sent3: The tactilities of the fluffy pillow made it irresistible to squeeze.
meanings.sent4: His artwork aimed to evoke the tactilities of different textures through visual representation.
meanings.sent5: The tactilities of the sculpture were so realistic that it seemed almost lifelike.

meanings.definition: The ability to perceive through touch.
meanings.sent1: Her cat's tactilities allowed it to navigate in the dark with ease.
meanings.sent2: The tactilities of his fingers were so sensitive, he could feel the slightest breeze.
meanings.sent3: The robot's advanced tactilities helped it distinguish between different textures.
meanings.sent4: She relied on her tactilities to identify objects when her eyes were closed.
meanings.sent5: The tactilities of the blind man were so acute, he could read Braille with great precision.
